subject: Olympic Games
Crime Victims, Compensation of
lead_paragraph: The Olympic silver medalist and former University of Hawaii standout Kim Willoughby pleaded no contest to assault in Honolulu. Under a plea agreement, Willoughby will be sentenced to five years’ probation. She must also pay an undetermined amount of restitution to the victim, Sara Daniel. Daniel sustained a broken nasal bone and eye socket when Willoughby was said to have punched her at a Honolulu nightclub in 2006. The plea came in the wake of a May 7 announcement by the Italian Olympic Committee that Willoughby tested positive for a steroid, nandrolone, after her Italian club Perugia played Cesena on April 5.
